issue.title: Add support for setting shape inference function on fused nodes

repository.name: onnxruntime
repository.description: ONNX Runtime: cross-platform, high performance ML inferencing and training accelerator

issue.body:
**Description**: See #7006. 

The ability to manually set a shape inference function for function-based nodes is useful for execution providers who perform node-fusion during graph partitioning. While normally shape info is computed before partitioning and hence is preserved by node fusion, in the case of graph transforms that operate _after_ partitioning (level 3 and above, e.g. NHWC graph transformations) shape info can be reset or new nodeArgs created. In such cases, rather than manually setting shape info in every graph transform that deals with fused nodes, it can be cleaner to just define the shape inference function upfront.

body:
Do you have a model that reproduces the issue?

AFAIK there are two paths to a Function based node. 
1) An ONNX function based operator is expanded to its component nodes as we don't have an implementation of the function. 
2) Nodes are fused by an execution provider into a single function based node during graph partitioning.

For #1, the code that expands the ONNX FunctionProto sets the type/shape inferencing function here: https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/368e4a324f5235823cd8a948c505536b13e31ada/onnxruntime/core/graph/function.cc#L322-L330

For #2, the ONNX type/shape inferencing would have already happened prior to fusion (shape inferencing is run during model loading, which completes before partitioning), so the output values from the fusion should already have type/shape info.

I looked again and the sequence of steps that reproduces this issue is this
* After partitioning, we create a fused node for e.g. QLinearAdd + Relu in our EP
* A level 3 graph transformer (e.g. NHWC conversion) is registered that replaces the inputs and outputs of the fused node.
* Since these are newly created NodeArgs, the previous shape inference info is no longer present. Hence when graph.Resolve() is called and shape-inference is again performed, since the fused node lacks any shape inference function we end up with no shape on the output (which prevents shape info from being computed for any downstream nodes as well).

That makes more sense. I added some debug output and ran one of the unit tests that does some node fusion (InternalTestingEP.TestSaveAndLoadOrtModel) and the shape info was maintained as expected in that case. 

@tracysh Can the NHWC transformer add shape info to newly created NodeArgs when it runs?

I think the expected result of fusing nodes is that the same output names are still produced, and hence no need for special handling of the shape info. 

I assume if you're creating new NodeArg instances you're also having to update downstream nodes to change input names as well, and that's getting beyond simply fusing nodes.

FWIW I'm not against adding a shape inferencing function to the onnxruntime::Function based node if there's a clear need for it. Just because it doesn't fit the normal node fusion scenarios doesn't mean it wouldn't be valuable, however there should be a unit test and clear explanation of when and how it should be used in a PR that adds it.

@skottmckay
I'd be happy to update the PR to add the unit test.

As for applicable use-cases: even though strictly speaking performing shape-inference for fused nodes by calling into a custom function during `graph.Resolve()` will have the same end-result as manually setting shape info during graph transforms, doing the latter leads to a weird asymmetry between processing "normal" nodes and "fused ones" – graph transforms for the former can be agnostic to the input/output shapes, whereas transforms for the latter must explicitly set shape info.

Given that it requires < 4 lines of code to add support for this, I think it's worth adding it so graph transforms can be kept as simple as possible.

Edit: I've updated the PR if you'd like to take a look.
